questions.question: What is DNA test
questions.answer: A DNA test is a test used to identify and analyze the genetic information in a person's DNA.

questions.question: What is cancer
questions.answer: Cancer is a group of diseases characterized by the uncontrolled growth and spread of abnormal cells.

questions.question: What is diabetes
questions.answer: Diabetes is a chronic condition characterized by high levels of sugar (glucose) in the blood.

questions.question: What is Alzheimer's disease
questions.answer: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive disorder that causes brain cells to degenerate and die, leading to memory loss and cognitive decline.

questions.question: What is hypertension
questions.answer: Hypertension, or high blood pressure, is a condition in which the force of blood against the artery walls is consistently too high.

questions.question: What is a heart attack
questions.answer: A heart attack, also known as a myocardial infarction, occurs when blood flow to a part of the heart is blocked for a long enough time that part of the heart muscle is damaged or dies.

questions.question: What is asthma
questions.answer: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition characterized by inflammation and narrowing of the airways, leading to difficulty breathing, wheezing, and coughing.

questions.question: What is arthritis
questions.answer: Arthritis is a term used to describe inflammation of the joints, which can cause pain, stiffness, and swelling.

questions.question: What is depression
questions.answer: Depression is a mood disorder characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest or pleasure in activities.

questions.question: What is anxiety
questions.answer: Anxiety is a natural response to stress or danger, but when it becomes excessive and persistent, it can interfere with daily activities and quality of life.

questions.question: What is schizophrenia
questions.answer: Schizophrenia is a severe mental disorder characterized by disturbances in thought, perception, and behavior, often including hallucinations and delusions.

questions.question: What is bipolar disorder
questions.answer: Bipolar disorder is a mental illness characterized by extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).

questions.question: What is a stroke
questions.answer: A stroke occurs when blood flow to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced, depriving brain tissue of oxygen and nutrients, leading to brain cell death.

questions.question: What is HIV/AIDS
questions.answer: HIV (human immunodeficiency virus) is a virus that attacks the body's immune system, and AIDS (acquired immunodeficiency syndrome) is the most advanced stage of HIV infection, characterized by severe damage to the immune system.

questions.question: What is osteoporosis
questions.answer: Osteoporosis is a condition characterized by weak, brittle bones that are more susceptible to fractures and breaks.

questions.question: What is obesity
questions.answer: Obesity is a medical condition characterized by excessive accumulation of body fat, which can have negative effects on health.

questions.question: What is autism
questions.answer: Autism, or autism spectrum disorder (ASD), refers to a range of conditions characterized by challenges with social skills, repetitive behaviors, speech, and nonverbal communication.

questions.question: What is Parkinson's disease
questions.answer: Parkinson's disease is a progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement, causing tremors, stiffness, and difficulty with balance and coordination.

questions.question: What is multiple sclerosis (MS)
questions.answer: Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a chronic disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain and spinal cord, leading to symptoms such as fatigue, muscle weakness, and difficulty with coordination and balance.

questions.question: What is cataract
questions.answer: A cataract is a clouding of the lens in the eye that affects vision, typically occurring with age.

questions.question: What is glaucoma
questions.answer: Glaucoma is a group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often as a result of increased pressure within the eye, leading to vision loss and blindness.

questions.question: What is chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
questions.answer: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a group of progressive lung diseases, including emphysema and chronic bronchitis, that make it difficult to breathe.

questions.question: What is hepatitis
questions.answer: Hepatitis is inflammation of the liver, most commonly caused by a viral infection but also by other factors such as alcohol use, medications, and autoimmune diseases.

questions.question: What is a concussion
questions.answer: A concussion is a mild traumatic brain injury that occurs when a blow or jolt to the head disrupts normal brain function, leading to symptoms such as headache, confusion, and dizziness.

questions.question: What is a kidney stone
questions.answer: A kidney stone is a hard, crystalline mineral deposit that forms in the kidney and can cause severe pain when it moves through the urinary tract.

questions.question: What is fibromyalgia
questions.answer: Fibromyalgia is a disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, sleep disturbances, and mood issues.

questions.question: What is irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
questions.answer: Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common gastrointestinal disorder characterized by abdominal pain, bloating, and changes in bowel habits, without any evidence of underlying damage or disease.

questions.question: What is sleep apnea
questions.answer: Sleep apnea is a sleep disorder characterized by pauses in breathing or shallow breaths during sleep, often leading to poor sleep quality and daytime fatigue.

questions.question: What is a hernia
questions.answer: A hernia occurs when an organ or fatty tissue protrudes through a weak spot or tear in the surrounding muscle or connective tissue, typically in the abdomen or groin.

questions.question: What is gout
questions.answer: Gout is a form of arthritis characterized by sudden and severe pain, redness, and swelling in the joints, often affecting the big toe.

questions.question: What is anemia
questions.answer: Anemia is a condition characterized by a deficiency of red blood cells or hemoglobin, resulting in reduced oxygen transport to the body's tissues and organs.

questions.question: What is epilepsy
questions.answer: Epilepsy is a neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures, which can vary widely in severity and frequency.

questions.question: What is rheumatoid arthritis
questions.answer: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disease that causes chronic inflammation of the joints, leading to pain, stiffness, and swelling.

questions.question: What is psoriasis
questions.answer: Psoriasis is a chronic skin condition characterized by red, itchy, and scaly patches of skin, often affecting the elbows, knees, scalp, and lower back.

questions.question: What is endometriosis
questions.answer: Endometriosis is a painful disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of the uterus (endometrium) grows outside the uterus, leading to inflammation, pain, and other symptoms.

questions.question: What is lupus
questions.answer: Lupus is a chronic autoimmune disease in which the body's immune system attacks its own tissues and organs, leading to inflammation and damage in various parts of the body.

questions.question: What is Crohn's disease
questions.answer: Crohn's disease is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease characterized by inflammation of the digestive tract, leading to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss.

questions.question: What is ulcerative colitis
questions.answer: Ulcerative colitis is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease characterized by inflammation and ulcers in the lining of the colon and rectum, leading to symptoms such as abdominal pain, diarrhea, and rectal bleeding.

questions.question: What is migraines
questions.answer: Migraines are a type of headache disorder characterized by recurrent, severe headaches often accompanied by other symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.

questions.question: What is chronic kidney disease (CKD)
questions.answer: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a progressive condition characterized by the gradual loss of kidney function over time, leading to kidney failure if left untreated.

questions.question: What is hypothyroidism
questions.answer: Hypothyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone, leading to symptoms such as fatigue, weight gain, and cold intolerance.

questions.question: What is hyperthyroidism
questions.answer: Hyperthyroidism is a condition in which the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone, leading to symptoms such as weight loss, rapid heart rate, and nervousness.

questions.question: What is chronic pain
questions.answer: Chronic pain is pain that persists for weeks, months, or even years, often long after an injury or underlying cause has healed.

questions.question: What is chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)
questions.answer: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS), also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that doesn't improve with rest and is worsened by physical or mental activity.

questions.question: What is osteoarthritis
questions.answer: Osteoarthritis is a degenerative joint disease characterized by the breakdown of cartilage in the joints, leading to pain, stiffness, and loss of mobility.

questions.question: What is pancreatitis
questions.answer: Pancreatitis is inflammation of the pancreas, a gland located behind the stomach that plays a key role in digestion and blood sugar regulation.

questions.question: What is chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
questions.answer: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a group of progressive lung diseases, including emphysema and chronic bronchitis, that make it difficult to breathe.
